body:
Several dependencies failed to build when doing `spack install` of environment spec but the same packages built without issues when specified manually one at a time. Reporting this issue  here with intel-19.0.4.227 on linux-rhel7-broadwell system but it also happens with other versions of the Intel compiler toolchain. 

All failed packages appear to have a dependency on libiconv so this may be a libiconv issue, but it also looks like a spack environment issue since the packages install correctly when specified individually. The list of packages that failed:

- tar@1.32
- libxml2@2.9.10
- gettext@0.20.2
### Steps to reproduce the issue

#### 'tar' is installed as a dependency of amg2013 included in my spack environment spec. 
```console
$ spack install 
...
[+] /usr/tcetmp
==> 2836: Installing tar
==> Fetching https://ftpmirror.gnu.org/tar/tar-1.32.tar.gz
################################################################################################################################################################################# 100.0%
==> Staging archive: /var/tmp/marathe1/spack-stage/spack-stage-tar-1.32-lnavetd4nivff2wbnrnsi4priop2h3si/tar-1.32.tar.gz
==> Created stage in /var/tmp/marathe1/spack-stage/spack-stage-tar-1.32-lnavetd4nivff2wbnrnsi4priop2h3si
==> No patches needed for tar
==> 2836: tar: Building tar [AutotoolsPackage]
==> 2836: tar: Executing phase: 'autoreconf'
==> 2836: tar: Executing phase: 'configure'
==> Error: KeyError: 'No spec with name iconv in tar@1.32%intel@19.0.4.227 cflags="-qopenmp" cppflags="-qopenmp" cxxflags="-qopenmp"  arch=linux-rhel7-broadwell ^libiconv@1.16%intel@19.0.4.227 cflags="-qopenmp" cppflags="-qopenmp" cxxflags="-qopenmp"  arch=linux-rhel7-broadwell'

/usr/WS2/marathe1/spack-test/var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/tar/package.py:32, in configure_args:
         30    def configure_args(self):
         31        return [
  >>     32            '--with-libiconv-prefix={0}'.format(self.spec['iconv'].prefix),
         33        ]

See build log for details:
  /var/tmp/marathe1/spack-stage/spack-stage-tar-1.32-lnavetd4nivff2wbnrnsi4priop2h3si/spack-build-out.txt

==> Error: Failed to install tar due to ChildError: KeyError: 'No spec with name iconv in tar@1.32%intel@19.0.4.227 cflags="-qopenmp" cppflags="-qopenmp" cxxflags="-qopenmp"  arch=linux-rhel7-broadwell ^libiconv@1.16%intel@19.0.4.227 cflags="-qopenmp" cppflags="-qopenmp" cxxflags="-qopenmp"  arch=linux-rhel7-broadwell'
/usr/WS2/marathe1/spack-test/var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/tar/package.py:32, in configure_args:
         30    def configure_args(self):
         31        return [
  >>     32            '--with-libiconv-prefix={0}'.format(self.spec['iconv'].prefix),
         33        ]

See build log for details:
  /var/tmp/marathe1/spack-stage/spack-stage-tar-1.32-lnavetd4nivff2wbnrnsi4priop2h3si/spack-build-out.txt
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/WS2/marathe1/spack-test/lib/spack/spack/spec.py", line 3180, in __getitem__
    (x for x in self.traverse()
StopIteration

During handling of the above exception, another exception occurred:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/WS2/marathe1/spack-test/lib/spack/spack/build_environment.py", line 813, in child_process
    return_value = function()
  File "/usr/WS2/marathe1/spack-test/lib/spack/spack/installer.py", line 1123, in build_process
    phase(pkg.spec, pkg.prefix)
  File "/usr/WS2/marathe1/spack-test/lib/spack/spack/package.py", line 108, in phase_wrapper
    phase(spec, prefix)
  File "/usr/WS2/marathe1/spack-test/lib/spack/spack/build_systems/autotools.py", line 298, in configure
    options += self.configure_args()
  File "/usr/WS2/marathe1/spack-test/var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/tar/package.py", line 33, in configure_args
    ]
  File "/usr/WS2/marathe1/spack-test/lib/spack/spack/spec.py", line 3185, in __getitem__
    raise KeyError("No spec with name %s in %s" % (name, self))
KeyError: 'No spec with name iconv in tar@1.32%intel@19.0.4.227 cflags="-qopenmp" cppflags="-qopenmp" cxxflags="-qopenmp"  arch=linux-rhel7-broadwell ^libiconv@1.16%intel@19.0.4.227 cflags="-qopenmp" cppflags="-qopenmp" cxxflags="-qopenmp"  arch=linux-rhel7-broadwell'
...

```

#### Installing 'tar' with intel@19.0.4.227 manually succeeds without the above issue:
```console
$ spack install tar%intel@19.0.4.227
[+] /usr/WS2/marathe1/spack-test/opt/spack/linux-rhel7-broadwell/intel-19.0.4.227/libiconv-1.16-6ryoslkgj3hutehzzimemkhyefeaj6s6
==> 8275: Installing tar

==> 8275: tar: Executing phase: 'install'
==> 8275: tar: Successfully installed tar

...
```

### Information on your system

$ spack debug report
* **Spack:** 0.14.2-1298-b60ab6e
* **Python:** 3.7.2
* **Platform:** linux-rhel7-broadwell
Compiler: Intel-C (intel-19.0.4.227)
title: Some dependencies failed to build with `spack install` of environment spec
